pull.title: docs: Update rpcbind doc to match the manpage
pull.body:
The `rpcbind` documentation on the example file should match the Manpage. Even more they have opposite meanings. 

This should close #9272

rename.from: Update `rpcbind` doc to match the manpage closes #9272
rename.to: Update `rpcbind` doc to match the manpage

events.body: Please fix the trailing whitespace on the lines you've modified.
Unfortunately this file isn't really maintained. Couldn't we remove the help texts and refer everyone to the manpages/`bitcoind -help`?

events.message:
Update `rpcbind` doc to match the manpage

Also should close #9272

events.body: @fanquake I amended the commit with the fix. I agree with @MarcoFalke if the file is not maintained it should be refered to the Manpage, it is however usually expected from a standard Debian package to offer an example conf in /usr/share/doc.

I vaguely remember we had a script at some point that generated a sample `bitcoin.conf` from the option help, this would be more convenient than manually maintaining documentation in multiple places. No idea though. Didn't even know this file was shipped.

I tried looking for the script and could not find it. I am willing to make a new script to generate this file, is it ok to do it in python ? 

 Also there some sections in the sample conf with more details which are not in the Man, maybe they should moved the Man ?

On November 21, 2018 11:27:06 AM GMT+01:00, "Wladimir J. van der Laan" <notifications@github.com> wrote:
>BTW this will change with #14532
>
>-- 
>You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
>Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub:
>https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14740#issuecomment-440612921

-- 
Sent from my Android device with K-9 Mail. Please excuse my brevity.
@luke-jr can you please check whether this matches the changes you did in  #14532

rename.from: Update `rpcbind` doc to match the manpage
rename.to: docs: Update rpcbind doc to match the manpage

events.body: @sp4ke Are you able to follow up here?

@fanquake sorry missed the notifications. I think the best would be to generate the doc from the manpage as previously stated. I will make a PR if I have sometime. It would be great if someone could share previous work done on this task so I can pick it up

<!--5d09a71f8925f3f132321140b44b946d-->The last travis run for this pull request was 270 days ago and is thus outdated. To trigger a fresh travis build, this pull request should be closed and re-opened.

issue.title: doc: Refer in rpcbind doc to the manpage
issue.body:
The help was outdated, so refer to the updated manpage instead.


* closes #14740
* closes #9272

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#16634](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/16634.html) (doc: Refer in rpcbind doc to the manpage by MarcoFalke)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -63,8 +63,11 @@
 # server=1 tells Bitcoin-Qt and bitcoind to accept JSON-RPC commands
 #server=0
 
-# Bind to given address to listen for JSON-RPC connections. Use [host]:port notation for IPv6.
-# This option can be specified multiple times (default: bind to all interfaces)
+# Bind to given address to listen for JSON-RPC connections. This option is ignored
+# unless `-rpcallowip` is also passed. Port is optional and overrides `-rpcport`.
+# Use [host]:port notation for IPv6.  This option can be specified multiple
+# times (default: 127.0.0.1 and ::1 i.e., localhost, or if `-rpcallowip` has
+# been specified, 0.0.0.0 and :: i.e., all addresses)
comments.body: Default is only ever localhost now.
